headline: Video-sharing app Vine is returning 'in AI form', Musk says
summary: Elon Musk's social media company X is bringing back popular video-sharing platform Vine in "AI form", the billionaire tech-entrepreneur said on Thursday, almost nine years after the app was discontinued. Musk made the announcement in a post on X, formerly Twitter, but did not provide further details. X did not immediately respond to a Reuters request seeking more information on the reboot.

headline: Tesla shares sink as Musk says it could face some 'rough quarters' ahead
summary: Tesla shares sank Thursday after CEO Elon Musk said the company could face a “few rough quarters” as it transitions to a future focused less on selling cars and more on offering people rides in self-driving cars.  Tesla faces the loss of the $7,500 EV tax credit and stands to make much less money from selling regulatory credits to other automakers after recent changes to federal tax law.  Musk spent the call talking less about car sales and more about robotaxis, automated driving software and robotics, which he says is the future of the company.

Musk spent the call talking less about car sales and more about robotaxis, automated driving software and robotics, which he says is the future of the company.

headline: Tesla's hope-based story fades: Future of robotaxi, cheaper EV
summary: Tesla (TSLA) missed on second quarter earnings. The company also revealed its cheaper electric vehicle (EV) model will enter volume production in late 2025, but investor patience is wearing thin. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporters Allie Canal, Pras Subramanian, and Josh Schafer break down why slowing core auto sales and vague timelines on robotaxis and artificial intelligence (AI) are dragging on the stock. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Trump says he wants Musk and his companies to thrive in US
summary: "I want Elon, and all businesses within our Country, to THRIVE."  The statement follows Musk's warning to Tesla  investors on Wednesday that U.S. government cuts in support for electric vehicle makers could lead to a "few rough quarters" for the company.  Musk spent more than a quarter of a billion dollars to help Trump win November's presidential election and led the Department of Government Efficiency's chaotic effort to slash the budget and cut the federal workforce.

headline: Tesla faces 'a few rough quarters' from end of US EV support: Musk
summary: STORY: Tesla's in for a "few rough quarters", says its CEO Elon Musk, citing U.S. government cuts in support for electric vehicle makers.That's as Tesla posted its worst quarterly sales decline in over a decade Wednesday.Overall revenue fell 12%, despite the launch of a refreshed version of Tesla's best-selling Model Y SUV - which investors had hoped would boost sales.Revenue and profit were also hurt by a 51% dive in sales of regulatory credits.Those credits are bought from Tesla by other automakers who have difficulty complying with government emissions rules.The U.S. government later this year is cutting tax credits of up to $7,500 for EV buyers.:: FileWhen asked on a quarterly results conference call about the credits, Musk predicted "a few rough quarters" before a wave of revenue from self-driving software and services begins late next year.Tesla shares fell nearly 5% after his comments.In the meantime, Tesla says it is working on a new, cheaper car - with a few initial units made by the end of June.But production would ramp up next quarter, slower than initially expected.The company also said it continued to expect volume production of its custom-built robotaxi - called the Cybercab - and Semi Truck in 2026.Much of the company's trillion-dollar valuation hangs on its bet on humanoid robots and on its robotaxi service.But one analyst - CEO of Systematic Ventures Max Wolff - was skeptical of its chances to turn fortunes."The problem is there's other guys who have done more rides with less issues in a Robotaxi, particularly Waymo. This is sort of a major competitor here who's been at this longer, done many more rides and seems to have had a smoother integration. For the robotaxi business to rescue Tesla, as some had hoped, it would have had to have gotten a lot further, a lot faster than it has."

raw.headline: Tesla faces 'a few rough quarters' from end of US EV support: Musk
raw.summary: STORY: Tesla's in for a "few rough quarters", says its CEO Elon Musk, citing U.S. government cuts in support for electric vehicle makers.That's as Tesla posted its worst quarterly sales decline in over a decade Wednesday.Overall revenue fell 12%, despite the launch of a refreshed version of Tesla's best-selling Model Y SUV - which investors had hoped would boost sales.Revenue and profit were also hurt by a 51% dive in sales of regulatory credits.Those credits are bought from Tesla by other automakers who have difficulty complying with government emissions rules.The U.S. government later this year is cutting tax credits of up to $7,500 for EV buyers.:: FileWhen asked on a quarterly results conference call about the credits, Musk predicted "a few rough quarters" before a wave of revenue from self-driving software and services begins late next year.Tesla shares fell nearly 5% after his comments.In the meantime, Tesla says it is working on a new, cheaper car - with a few initial units made by the end of June.But production would ramp up next quarter, slower than initially expected.The company also said it continued to expect volume production of its custom-built robotaxi - called the Cybercab - and Semi Truck in 2026.Much of the company's trillion-dollar valuation hangs on its bet on humanoid robots and on its robotaxi service.But one analyst - CEO of Systematic Ventures Max Wolff - was skeptical of its chances to turn fortunes."The problem is there's other guys who have done more rides with less issues in a Robotaxi, particularly Waymo. This is sort of a major competitor here who's been at this longer, done many more rides and seems to have had a smoother integration. For the robotaxi business to rescue Tesla, as some had hoped, it would have had to have gotten a lot further, a lot faster than it has."

headline: Tesla shares drop almost 6% after results
summary: LONDON/MILAN (Reuters) -Tesla shares fell nearly 6% in early trading in Europe on Thursday, after Elon Musk's electric vehicle maker posted its worst quarterly decline in sales in over a decade.  On a conference call, chief executive Musk said U.S. government cuts in support for electric vehicle makers could lead to a "few rough quarters" for the company before a wave of revenue from self-driving software and services begins late next year.

raw.headline: Tesla shares drop almost 6% after results
raw.summary: LONDON/MILAN (Reuters) -Tesla shares fell nearly 6% in early trading in Europe on Thursday, after Elon Musk's electric vehicle maker posted its worst quarterly decline in sales in over a decade.  On a conference call, chief executive Musk said U.S. government cuts in support for electric vehicle makers could lead to a "few rough quarters" for the company before a wave of revenue from self-driving software and services begins late next year.

headline: European car sales slump in June as automakers' woes deepen
summary: New car sales in Europe fell more than 5% in June, the European Automobile Manufacturers Association (ACEA) said on Thursday, in a reflection of the global challenges faced by automakers. Tesla lost market share for a sixth consecutive month despite a rise in overall sales of electric cars, while the four best-selling groups in Europe, Volkswagen, Stellantis, Renault and Hyundai, all sold fewer cars than in June 2024. WHY IT'S IMPORTANT European auto makers have booked multi-billion losses and issued profit warnings as they struggle to handle competition from China, U.S. import tariffs of 25%, and domestic regulations aimed at speeding up the EV transition.

raw.headline: European car sales slump in June as automakers' woes deepen
raw.summary: New car sales in Europe fell more than 5% in June, the European Automobile Manufacturers Association (ACEA) said on Thursday, in a reflection of the global challenges faced by automakers. Tesla lost market share for a sixth consecutive month despite a rise in overall sales of electric cars, while the four best-selling groups in Europe, Volkswagen, Stellantis, Renault and Hyundai, all sold fewer cars than in June 2024. WHY IT'S IMPORTANT European auto makers have booked multi-billion losses and issued profit warnings as they struggle to handle competition from China, U.S. import tariffs of 25%, and domestic regulations aimed at speeding up the EV transition.

headline: Chipmaker STMicro reports second-quarter loss, hit by restructuring costs
summary: AMSTERDAM (Reuters) -STMicroelectronics reported a second-quarter loss on Thursday, a performance that was worse than market expectations and hit by restructuring costs.  The operating loss included a $190 million impairment, restructuring charges and other costs for the quarter, STMicro said in a statement.  Without the restructuring and impairment costs, ST Micro said its profits would have reached $57 million.

raw.headline: Chipmaker STMicro reports second-quarter loss, hit by restructuring costs
raw.summary: AMSTERDAM (Reuters) -STMicroelectronics reported a second-quarter loss on Thursday, a performance that was worse than market expectations and hit by restructuring costs.  The operating loss included a $190 million impairment, restructuring charges and other costs for the quarter, STMicro said in a statement.  Without the restructuring and impairment costs, ST Micro said its profits would have reached $57 million.

headline: Elon Musk says Tesla will start adding vehicles it doesn’t directly own into its robotaxi network next year
summary: The Austin-based EV company is still working on taking safety drivers out of the passenger seats and expanding into new cities.

headline: Tesla (TSLA) Stock Gains Momentum as Elon Embraces ‘Wartime CEO’ Role
summary: Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) is one of the AI Stocks in the Spotlight Right Now. On July 22, Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives reiterated an “Outperform” rating on the stock with a $500.00 price target. Investor sentiment has drastically shifted from what it was three months ago, with investors now viewing Elon as a “wartime CEO” with a focus […]

headline: Elon Musk wants more control of Tesla so activist investors can’t boot him—but not so much the board can’t fire him if he goes ‘crazy’
summary: He said his ownership stake is "a major concern," noting he hoped the Tesla board addresses the issue at its annual shareholder meeting in November.
